meanings.definition: A straight line that connects two nonadjacent vertices of a polygon.
meanings.sent1: The diagonals of the shape intersect at the center.
meanings.sent2: She drew the diagonals of the square to find its center.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat walked along the diagonals of the rug, leaving paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His path through the forest resembled the diagonals of a complex maze.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold strokes to represent the diagonals in her painting.

meanings.definition: A line segment that joins two opposite corners of a square, rectangle, or other geometric shape.
meanings.sent1: The diagonals of the rectangle were equal in length.
meanings.sent2: He measured the diagonals of the square to check for symmetry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat stretched out lazily along the diagonals of the rug.
meanings.sent4: The road ahead seemed to stretch out like endless diagonals in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast long shadows along the diagonals of the fence.
